title: Chinese Government provides TT$100 million grant -- via January 2020 ETCA -- for Forensic Science Center Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#69011 and ID#95316)
description: On January 7, 2020, the Chinese Government provided a TT$100 million grant to the Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of National Security for the ongoing construction of the New Forensic Science Center in Mt. Hope. Grant funds were committed via an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) signed by the Minister of National Security and the Chinese Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago (as captured via Project ID#95316).  The new building is expected to replace the current smaller one in St. James. The building is set to go up in two stages: first a new main forensic sciences building, and then a "L-shaped" DNA storage building. The new center is being constructed with the goal of alleviating personnel and infrastructure issues that have been plaguing the forensic department for some time.   The Trinidadians requested funding for the project from China after the Prime Minister visited a similarly Chinese-funded forensics center in Jamaica. As of January 2020, the project had not yet broken ground despite its proposed completion date by the beginning of 2020.   The 2020 grant represents additional funding for the project after the Chinese Government provided a $10 million dollar grant in 2018 (as captured via Project ID#69011).
staff_comments: 1. Source #180460 details a signing ceremony for an exchange of letters with Chinese Ambassador Fang Qiu with regard to the construction of a new Trinidad and Tobago Forensic Science Centre (TTFSC).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides TT$100 million grant -- via January 2020 ETCA -- for Forensic Science Center Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#69011 and ID#95316)

# Description
On January 7, 2020, the Chinese Government provided a TT$100 million grant to the Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of National Security for the ongoing construction of the New Forensic Science Center in Mt. Hope. Grant funds were committed via an Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement (ETCA) signed by the Minister of National Security and the Chinese Ambassador to Trinidad and Tobago (as captured via Project ID#95316).  The new building is expected to replace the current smaller one in St. James. The building is set to go up in two stages: first a new main forensic sciences building, and then a "L-shaped" DNA storage building. The new center is being constructed with the goal of alleviating personnel and infrastructure issues that have been plaguing the forensic department for some time.   The Trinidadians requested funding for the project from China after the Prime Minister visited a similarly Chinese-funded forensics center in Jamaica. As of January 2020, the project had not yet broken ground despite its proposed completion date by the beginning of 2020.   The 2020 grant represents additional funding for the project after the Chinese Government provided a $10 million dollar grant in 2018 (as captured via Project ID#69011).
justification: Project focuses on construction of a forensic science center, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Forensic Science Center construction, focus on improving forensic department infrastructure

title: Shanghai Municipality provides donation of COVID-19 medical supplies to the Port of Spain City Government in April 2020
description: On April 23, 2020, the Shanghai Municipality made a donation of various anti-epidemic materials to the Port of Spain City Government. Ambassador Song Yumin handed over the donation to Joel Martinez, the mayor of the Port of Spain.   The donation came after a similar shipment of medical supplies was donated by Trinidad to Shanghai.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Shanghai Municipality provides donation of COVID-19 medical supplies to the Port of Spain City Government in April 2020

# Description
On April 23, 2020, the Shanghai Municipality made a donation of various anti-epidemic materials to the Port of Spain City Government. Ambassador Song Yumin handed over the donation to Joel Martinez, the mayor of the Port of Spain.   The donation came after a similar shipment of medical supplies was donated by Trinidad to Shanghai.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials, healthcare focus

title: China donates COVID-19 aid to Trinidad and Tobago in April 2020
description: On April 21, 2020, Ambassador Song Yumin officially handed over a batch of COVID-19 aid to Trinidad and Tobago. The package contained medical face masks, medical disposable protective clothing, infrared thermometers, disposable surgical gloves and medical isolation shoe covers. The materials arrived in Trinidad and Tobago on April 13. Trinidad and Tobago's Health Minister Terrence Deyalsingh accepted the materials from Ambassador Song Yumin.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates COVID-19 aid to Trinidad and Tobago in April 2020

# Description
On April 21, 2020, Ambassador Song Yumin officially handed over a batch of COVID-19 aid to Trinidad and Tobago. The package contained medical face masks, medical disposable protective clothing, infrared thermometers, disposable surgical gloves and medical isolation shoe covers. The materials arrived in Trinidad and Tobago on April 13. Trinidad and Tobago's Health Minister Terrence Deyalsingh accepted the materials from Ambassador Song Yumin.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical face masks, protective clothing, thermometers, gloves, and isolation shoe covers donated for COVID-19 response

title: Shanghai Municipality and Henan Provincial Government donate a COVID-19 PPE package to Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs in May 2020
description: On May 1st, 2020, the Shanghai Municipality and Henan Provincial Government donated a batch of COVID-19 Personal Equipment (PPE) to Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs. The package included 14,200 masks and 100 protective overalls.   The donation took place at the Office of the Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs. Song Yumin, Ambassador for the People’s Republic of China to the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, handed over the package to Senator Dennis Moses, the Minister of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs.
staff_comments: 1. Because the Shanghai Municipality and Henan Provincial Government both contributed an unknown number of supplies to this donation, AidData assumes each donor made an equal contribution. The total value of the donation is estimated to be $4,860.00, with each donor contributing an estimated USD 2,430.00 (USD 4,860.00 / 2 known contributors = USD 2,430.00).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Shanghai Municipality and Henan Provincial Government donate a COVID-19 PPE package to Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs in May 2020

# Description
On May 1st, 2020, the Shanghai Municipality and Henan Provincial Government donated a batch of COVID-19 Personal Equipment (PPE) to Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs. The package included 14,200 masks and 100 protective overalls.   The donation took place at the Office of the Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs. Song Yumin, Ambassador for the People’s Republic of China to the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, handed over the package to Senator Dennis Moses, the Minister of Foreign and CARICOM Affairs.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: COVID-19 PPE donation, masks and protective overalls, healthcare-related

title: China donates COVID-19 prevention supplies to the Tobago House of Assembly in June 2020
description: On June 2, 2020, the Chinese embassy reported that Ambassador Song Yumin handed over a shipment of COVID-19 prevention supplies to the Tobago House of Assembly, represented by Assembly Man Joel Jack. It is unclear what was included in the package.

title: China donates PPE to Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of National Security in December 2020
description: On December 11, 2020, Trinidad and Tobago's Ministry of National Security received a donation of PPE from China. The PPE will be used by the Trinidad and Tobago Defence Force to prevent the spread of Covid-19 and includes portable ventilators, patient monitors, medical face masks, protective coveralls, and medical goggles. The quantity of the donated PPE is unknown. T&T Minister of National Security Stuart R. Young M.P. accepted the donation.
combined_text:

HEALTH

The quantity of the donated PPE is unknown. T&T Minister of National Security Stuart R. Young M.P. accepted the donation.
justification: Project is a healthcare-related donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: PPE donation including ventilators, patient monitors, and protective equipment for Covid-19 response

title: China donates anti-epidemic materials to the Tunisian Ministry of Health in December 2020
description: On December 30th, 2020, Ambassador to Tunisia Zhang Jianguo provided anti-epidemic materials from the Government of China to the Tunisian Minister of Health Fauz Mehdi. The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Chinese Ministry of Defense donated anti-pandemic medical materials to the Tunisian Ministry of Defense in June 2020
description: On June 3, 2020, The Chinese Ministry of Defense provided the Tunisian Ministry of National Defense with new coronary pneumonia epidemic prevention and control medical supplies. At this handover ceremony, Ambassador Wang Wenbin, Defense Military Office Wang Zhenyu, and Brigadier General Vergani went to the airport to attend the handover ceremony. The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

At this handover ceremony, Ambassador Wang Wenbin, Defense Military Office Wang Zhenyu, and Brigadier General Vergani went to the airport to attend the handover ceremony. The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Government of China donates second batch of anti-epidemic materials to Tunisia in June 2020
description: On June 10, 2020, the second batch of anti-epidemic materials assisted by the Chinese government arrived in Tunisia for a handover ceremony. Chargé d’affaires Yuan Lijie and Brigadier General Firgani, the military security chief of the Ministry of Defense, were present to meet the materials, and signed handover certificates on behalf of the two governments. This batch consisted of N95 masks, new coronavirus nucleic acid test kits, medical eye masks, medical protective clothing, and surgical gloves. The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Government of China donates second batch of anti-epidemic materials to Tunisia in June 2020

# Description
On June 10, 2020, the second batch of anti-epidemic materials assisted by the Chinese government arrived in Tunisia for a handover ceremony. Chargé d’affaires Yuan Lijie and Brigadier General Firgani, the military security chief of the Ministry of Defense, were present to meet the materials, and signed handover certificates on behalf of the two governments. This batch consisted of N95 masks, new coronavirus nucleic acid test kits, medical eye masks, medical protective clothing, and surgical gloves. The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support and pandemic response without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Donation of medical supplies including masks, test kits, and protective equipment for Covid-19 response

title: Chinese Government donates medical supplies to Tunisia in April 2020
description: On April 16, 2020, the Chinese Government donated medical supplies to the Tunisian Ministry of Health. The supplies included N95 masks, nucleic acid testing kits, and medical goggles. The shipment of supplies was sent on April 15, 2020, arriving at an airport in Tunisia. Wang Wenbin, the Chinese Ambassador to Tunisia, Zhang Gengling, the Economic and Commercial Counselor at the Chinese Embassy, and the General Directorate of the Tunisian Ministry of Health received the supplies at the airport.   The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation on April 16, 2020. Wang Wenbin, the Chinese Ambassador to Tunisia, handed over the supplies to Tunisian Defense Minister Imed Hazgui. Following the ceremony, the two officials signed the handover certificate.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates medical supplies to Tunisia in April 2020

# Description
On April 16, 2020, the Chinese Government donated medical supplies to the Tunisian Ministry of Health. The supplies included N95 masks, nucleic acid testing kits, and medical goggles. The shipment of supplies was sent on April 15, 2020, arriving at an airport in Tunisia. Wang Wenbin, the Chinese Ambassador to Tunisia, Zhang Gengling, the Economic and Commercial Counselor at the Chinese Embassy, and the General Directorate of the Tunisian Ministry of Health received the supplies at the airport.   The purpose of this donation is to help Tunisia fight against the Covid-19 pandemic. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation on April 16, 2020. Wang Wenbin, the Chinese Ambassador to Tunisia, handed over the supplies to Tunisian Defense Minister Imed Hazgui. Following the ceremony, the two officials signed the handover certificate.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies donation, focus on healthcare and pandemic response
